website_summaries.verdict: These scissor-style stabilizing jacks can be used for standard car tire changes or RV stabilization. Lightweight for easy storage, but still heavy duty for larger vehicles.
pros: Sold as a set of two, offering more stability options
Lifting and lowering action is very smooth and controlled
cons: Screw mechanism not as sturdy as the frame
Some concerns about pin and plate alignment

customer_reviews.title: Quality scissor jacks ....lift your spirits.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made jacks. Smooth operation. Just be aware that the ground (base) pad is not a large rectangle shape (as depicted in photo). It's more like a "hour glass" shape which would require a wood block or larger base pad of some sort if using on sand or soft grade. Comes with hand crank handle, but order the optional 3/4" socket for an 18v battery drill ....you'll love it!! Jacks weigh 25 to 30 lbs. each, so consider this when you calculate your CGVW on your trailer. Very satisfied with the quality and this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: wayner-Take-1

customer_reviews.title: Not As Pictured
customer_reviews.text: Many differences that don't effect the way that I intend to use these (NOT CAMPER RELATED), however if the following differences are important to you, then look elsewhere! Neither the top nor the bottom have welded two piece construction. The bottom has a standard stamped piece just like virtually every other jack you will see. The top has two outward facing "L" brackets with three slots on each side for bolting jack to a camper's undercarriage. Again very much like what other jacks have. The jack is held together by bolts, not pins. The jacks are very heavy duty, and will work for my purposes (again.. . Not camper related!).
customer_reviews.author: LeeZ06

customer_reviews.title: Good but not like Picture
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well built and heavy duty but they do not match the picture. The mounting flanges are not rectangular, but triangular and so would not mount on my frame where needed. If you have a narrow frame rail (less than 2 inches thick), these may be a problem to mount. So I had to return them which was no problem at all since Amazon did the fulfillment. But they should correct the picture.
customer_reviews.author: adworksdh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome upgrade for those that value stability.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome upgrade to the factory models. These are easily 3x the weight and strength. Easy replacement. The trailer is now actually stable. If you have lightweight original jacks from the manufacturer (ForestRiver in my case). These are well worth the expense. Also, Take care on considering install location. Mine were attached to a thin plate that bent easily. I attached these directly to the I-Beam frame.
customer_reviews.author: NollCraft

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Made very well, quality product, came with everything needed to mount, picture shown is not the correct mounting brackets
customer_reviews.author: WTFeeders

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice and well made
customer_reviews.text: I was a little bit hesitant to try and take on the task of mounting these to my travel trailer as I have no experience doing so.. It was very easy to do and all necessary hardware was included. The jacks are very sturdy and the motion is extremely fluid. Would recommend to anyone needed replacements or like in my case just needing jacks they can mount to a travel trailer/rv.
customer_reviews.author: J Craig

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well built.
customer_reviews.text: Installed four of these on our Gulfstream Amerilite TT and they work beautifully! Cutting the old jacks off was the only difficult part of installing these jacks. These jacks are very well built and sturdy. I installed them at an angle instead of perpendicular as the instruction state because I read that doing so would provide less side to side and/or front to rear movement and that seems to work well. These jacks cost a little more than some of the jacks sold here on Amazon, but these appear to be build better, although I have not tried the cheaper jacks.
customer_reviews.author: Slowdog

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for trailer
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding replacements for the factory stabilizers on my pop up trailer. Perhaps a little overkill in terms of weight capability, but the smooth action and ease of use trump that. Even though a little large for a small trailer, they raise up to a very small profile, giving plenty of clearance. Quality of workmanship was very good compared to some other products.
customer_reviews.author: Spokanite

customer_reviews.title: Much more durable that then ones included with my 30' travel trailer.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a used travel trailer. The stabilizers were damaged on one side. Instead of trying to find a perfect match for the good ones, I replaced all four with these. The first thing I noticed was that these were much larger than I expected and they protruded from the sides of the trailer a little. That is not a big deal, just something to take into account since they could hit against something. Make sure you measure your trailer well before purchasing and installing these. They are much more robust than the original ones that were on the trailer and I have no doubt that they will last many years of continual use.
customer_reviews.author: Rob K

customer_reviews.title: Well made heavy duty jacks. Was testing them and ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made heavy duty jacks. Was testing them and put one close to the tire on my 32' camper. Lifted both tires off the ground using my battery drill. Thinking about installing one on each side for leveling or a tire change.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. Akers

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly like the picture
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality and well made, we use them to stabilize the back of our small class a motor home which in it's entirety only weighs 11,000 lbs and I can easily reach the point where i can no longer turn the jack with the wrench provided. Mine are different then the picture, mine have a 2 piece mounting plate vs the 1 piece shown. Doesn't really impact the functionality but it is not a very good business practice.
customer_reviews.author: gooddad

customer_reviews.title: VERY HEAVY DUTY
customer_reviews.text: These Jack's are VERY heavy duty. The original ones that are factory installed are extremely cheap in comparison. We have a problem with the camper rocking. I think these will fix that. Overall nice Jack's, sturdy built. Thanks for a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin G Frohlich

customer_reviews.title: I put these on the front and was very pleased with the stability of the camper
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered a second set of these jacks to replace the factory ones on my Jayco 17Z. Our 2010 only came with rear stabilizers and they were ok but I noticed the 2012's and up came with four. I put these on the front and was very pleased with the stability of the camper. I decided to order a second pair for two reasons: 1. I will only need one hand crank. 2. These are much more heavy duty then the factory stabilizers. Our camper only has a GVWR of 3500 pounds so some might say these are overkill but they keep the campers stabile. They are very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: JBR

customer_reviews.title: Worth Considering
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research before buying these jacks. Wanted jacks with a top plate that would easily bolt to the bottom of a trailer and provide the support to handle stabilizing my trailer when load a tractor or car. They are easy to install and give me the support and stability needed when loading and off loading heavy equipment. I like the fact that when retracted they have miminal exposure from the bottom of the trailer which reduces the likely hood of them catching objects sticking up from the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Francis X. Fanucci

customer_reviews.title: Nice replacement jacks
customer_reviews.text: These jacks are a great upgrade over the jacks that came with our 2014 Keystone Cougar. The jacks we had were good jacks, but I bent one and decide to replace both the rear jacks. These are much heavier and should give us years of use. I will eventually replace our front jacks with these as well.
customer_reviews.author: B. Trankina

customer_reviews.title: Jacks are well made but the mounting plate is a bit too large
customer_reviews.text: Had to attach some cross bracing which was no picnic. The mounting plates are much larger than any frame material on the RV. These newer RVs have smaller framing to make them lighter. Overall the Jacks are well made, strong and smooth. The swivel on the crank handle is a nice touch. If I order a second set of these, i will take one crank handle and cut the end off to chuck into a cordless drill and keep the other as a manual backup. Would have been 5 stars except for the mounting plate size.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Love Them
customer_reviews.text: These jacks are great, heavier than the ones on our camper. We left the top bracket from our old jacks on the frame and then bolted them in, then we didn't have to worry about lining up the holes or drilling new ones. You do have to crank a lot more times than our others but the drill attachment makes it quick
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy duty scissor jack
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace the front stabilizers on my 23ft camper. They are very solid and smooth to deploy and retract. I did not like the spot welds on the retainer washer, so I welded it a little more before I installed them. I appreciated the included mounting hardware. I will be buying another pair for the rear in the off-season.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon A

customer_reviews.title: Big step in quality over the manufacturer-supplied jacks. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Big step in quality over the manufacturer-supplied jacks. I welded these on the front of my new trailer. They wind and unwind smoothly and with ease, whereas the OEM jacks on the rear of my trailer catch and sometimes take a lot of effort to lower and lift. I'll be replacing the rear ones with another set of these sometime in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: A. Murillo

customer_reviews.title: Stops the shakes!
customer_reviews.text: These really make our class C RV a lot more comfortable. We no longer get tossed around when someone is walking across the RV. Also decreases the shaking around on very windy days.
customer_reviews.author: DarlaKay

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the Low Pro stabilizers that came on my trailer. They way twice as heavy and the mounting is much more robust. I only ordered two so I could see what they were like before ordering two more. These are more heavy duty, and quality is very good. I would recommend them for anyone looking to upgrade the factory installed cheep units.
customer_reviews.author: Scott_123

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product! Added these to our 20' popup camper
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! Added these to our 20' popup camper. We had the old flip down level jacks and they were very difficult at times. My husband put all 4 on in about 40 minutes and they are solid. Makes setting up and tearing down much easier on us now. Every bit worth the money, wish I would of bought these sooner. The crank came with the but I also bought the attachment for on your drill. Either way is good.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not seem to be as sturdy as the stabilizers I was replacing (all four got ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not seem to be as sturdy as the stabilizers I was replacing (all four got bent from a winter blizzard with 70 mph winds). The mounting holes did not line up with the original holes either so I had to drill new ones in the frame, which was not difficult but it was time consuming and dulled two drill bits. They do work well and I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: C. HEWI

customer_reviews.title: Brackets are completely incorrect to what was delivered. Needed ...
customer_reviews.text: Brackets are completely incorrect to what was delivered. Needed this type due to the single bracket but, the actual product has two separate brackets and will not work with my type of trailer.
customer_reviews.author: DavidC

customer_reviews.title: Beastly
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my travel trailer. I was not expecting them to be so heavy duty. They are beastly. They were super easy to install with supplied self tapping screws. Just make sure you drill a pilot hole that's the correct size. I like the fact that the handle piviots too. Makes it so you don't have to be directly parallel to the jack while raising or lowering them, although a drill works much faster. No complaints with these at all.
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: Super heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised at how heavy duty and high-quality these stabilizers are. I needed something to replace by terrible vintage stabilizers on my pop-up. Just one of these could lift the entire trailer, but are about the same prices as the cheap Harbor Freight ones. The quality and sturdiness of these stabilizers was surprising. So far these have held up very well and I'm looking forward to years and years of good use.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Good replacements
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up to replace the factory stabilizers on my pop out. I haven't used them on a trip yet, but these crank up with ease compared to a set I have from another mfg. I have to fight with the other set to crank them. I'll be picking up another set of the Husky ones before my next trip. At the moment I have them in place in the driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: Bracket that comes with it may not fit trailer. Keep old mounting brackets until your sure
customer_reviews.text: Well built and sturdy. Didn't like that you had to use flimsy brackets to mount to travel trailer when taking off old jacks.it would be helpful if this bracket was more universal
customer_reviews.author: dennis abitz

customer_reviews.title: Husky 24" Scissor Jack
customer_reviews.text: Bent one of my jacks on my travel trailer and wanted to replace them all. These Husky Jacks are about 3 times stronger and will offer much more stabilization to my ultra lite trailer. The mounting plates will match up and they tuck away while towing. They will easily lift the entire trailer off the ground but, will also provide a firm support especially on uneven ground. Excellent craftsmanship and the handle cranks are chrome plated and super heavy duty. Well worth the money and as always, Amazon delivered as quick as I needed them. Have already recommended to my camping buddies. Peace Out.
customer_reviews.author: Someones Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great Quailty.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced OEM Jacks on my 32’ Camper, Great quality BEEFY and easy install. Will be getting 2 more for the front. Don’t hesitate if you are thinking about these, well worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Moan

customer_reviews.title: Husky 76862 Scissor Jack--Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bent my factory ones the first time I went camping and had to replace the rear jacks--I purchased the Husky 76862 Scissor Jack and was so impressed with them, I ordered two more jacks, and replaced the front factory jacks--my camper is so much more solid and stable now---Great Product--also, came with the handle to crank the jacks and was impressed by the material and weight ---The handle is so much better than my factory jack handle !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lucas E. Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: ... the four corners of my RV and they work great. The weight load is rated at 6500 lbs ...
customer_reviews.text: I mounted them under the four corners of my RV and they work great. The weight load is rated at 6500 lbs each but, I unknowingly lifted my 16,000 RV off its hydraulic jacks with them, it stayed that way for the whole week with no problems. They appear to be much stronger than advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid well built jacks and very easy operation
customer_reviews.text: Solid well built jack and it is very easy to operate. I uses these jacks , which I purchased four in total , for my Toyota 4Runner while parkjed during off season. I also uses one jack to lift my cargo carrier up, which is attached to the 4Runner , during drysite camping. The jack is very easy to operate even the cargo carrier has more than 400 pounds of loads on it.
customer_reviews.author: P. SHING

customer_reviews.title: Great jacks, glad I bought them
customer_reviews.text: Great jacks, especially for the price. Bolted up on my little 18' travel trailer with no trouble. I raise and lower them with a cordless drill. They've given me to trouble whatsoever. I'm a contractor, I move the trailer around a lot, the jacks made a huge difference for me with ease of setup and a solid comfortable floor to walk on once I'm setup. Glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L. Seward

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: These are the best jacks I have ever seen for a camper. Heavy duty metal and large turn screw make them feel secure. They were a little harder to install due to my Lock-arm stabilizers and one of my old mounting brackets was welded but I still installed and removed the old ones in less than 90 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: jimglo845

customer_reviews.title: Thick metal.
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely heavy duty. Easy to install, well made.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianna Reid

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Jack
customer_reviews.text: Good relacement for the damaged one that was on my travel trailer or it comes with all the hardware for a first time install. This is a heavy duty jack and cranks up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Don K.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty jacks
customer_reviews.text: Huge upgrade from OEM 2015 camper jacks. Says made in China on the box, but man the quality is top notch and heavyduty thick steel. No regrets in the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Wow....nice!
customer_reviews.text: When I received the package, I could have sworn there were 4 jacks in the box. The other jacks I have received in the past don't even compare to these. I wish I had known about these before. These are heavy gage steel, even the handle is really nice. The "cheapest" is not always the best....pay a little more and get these, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Wood

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend. I used them to replace the rear stabilizers ...
customer_reviews.text: Item ships as described. Really robust. I know the labeling says not to use it to lift vehicle, but these are strong enough to do so. I highly recommend. I used them to replace the rear stabilizers on a 2007 Starcraft toy hauler. Going to purchase two more for the front. 10 times better than factory.
customer_reviews.author: Martin McHenry

customer_reviews.title: These Jacks Don't Work
customer_reviews.text: They're junk. If you don't hold pressure on the wrench, they unwind under the slightest load. You get what you pay for (if you're lucky). I would have been better off buying a pair of these at twice the price since this was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: sixgundan

customer_reviews.title: Great HD leveler supports.
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely HD units. Have not installed them on cargo trailer, but plan to have them welded to the frame. Note: These are not jacks. They are HD stabilizers
customer_reviews.author: BLC

customer_reviews.title: Great Stabilizing Jacks
customer_reviews.text: I bought these from Amazon.com Used Like New. Opened the package and dang they looked like new really couldn't tell!!!!!. I mounted these on my 5th wheel camper. They worked very well with helping stabilizing my camper. Not to mention all the hardware was in the box for the job. Theses are great jacks and name brand HUSKYS. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Burnette

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!
customer_reviews.text: These jack stands made leveling my camper so much easier! I had to buy a new one regardless because of the crank being busted off of the old one. I decided to buy the whole set and man am I glad I did. Pair this with the Camco 57363 Leveling Scissor Jack Socket and it will make leveling your camper a breeze! Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Moon

customer_reviews.title: nice product
customer_reviews.text: the Jacks are good quality and arrived in good condition but do not use the self tapping mounting bolt they are a cheap grade and break off easily , alternative is to drill and bolt or weld , I chose to weld
customer_reviews.author: JDH

customer_reviews.title: well built with one issue on one jack
customer_reviews.text: Great set of jacks and seem really superior to the ones the factory put on. They bolted on no problem, feel much heavier, and seemingly built very well. I only have one issue and that is on one of the jacks, the main threaded bar that goes through the jack that actually raises and lowers it is warped. So when I am spinning it, especially with a drill, it's pretty wobbly. It still raises and lowers and seems to hold but I bought new and expected new.... But not returning because it's already bolted on my RV and didn't want to have to remove and send back. Other than that, great product
customer_reviews.author: R. Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Use as intended!
customer_reviews.text: Some manufacturers use lifting and/or leveling in the description of these jacks. That's misleading as they are for stabilizing, not lifting/leveling! Husky puts a label on each one to remind you. Level the coach by putting blocks/boards under the wheels, then adjust the tongue jack.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Prettyman

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 32 ft jayco white hawk and I bought these jacks for added support on the center of the travel trailer. These were much higher quality then the jacks that came with the camper. I plan on ordering more and replacing the originals.
customer_reviews.author: tr

customer_reviews.title: Good good good!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, cheaper than buying from a camping store, easy enough to install. HOWEVER I wouldn't rely on the self tapping screws that come with it. I drilled a slightly bigger hole and used a nut and bolt instead
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacks!
customer_reviews.text: These Jacks are ten times better than those that came with our fifth wheel. We decided to add another set about midway of the coach to stabilize the unit more. Fantastic! We even discussed removing the existing jacks and replacing them with these. Heavy duty. Worth the $
customer_reviews.author: PaintKrazyGal

customer_reviews.title: Great stabelizers heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I just put these on and Im going to try them out this next weekend I know theyre going to work a lot better than my old ones, but the hardware yjat comes with these aren't good go to hardware store and get quality bolts for these. i
customer_reviews.author: Tony McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Great jacks replacing factory ones
customer_reviews.text: Great jacks replacing factory ones. The original ones were very flimsy! These are very well made and strong. They do weigh more than the original ones. These are around 15/lbs each. The old ones were about half that weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These jacks are very high quality. I ordered them to replace the damaged front jacks and now am ordering another set to replace the rear just because I like the quality. Even the crank is high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P.

customer_reviews.title: Allot better that stock odd that was on my popup camper
customer_reviews.text: Allot better that stock odd that was on my popup camper. Replaced the two back ones due to backing into a hill and bending them. Will be replacing front ones soon even though they are not bent out broke cause the husky ones are a much better product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overkill?
customer_reviews.text: These are serious jacks. Way more stout than the original equipment. I dont think it is possible I will ever have issues with these.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Morin

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: They did the job of stabilizing my trailer just fine. But are just a little light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wingfield

customer_reviews.title: Good Jacks - Bad Screws
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, the jacks are great. But upgrade the screws or weld them on. The hex head on the first screw rounded the first time I went to use it. I threw them all away and went and bought a better grade. But other than that, these really are good.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I am giving 5 stars.. but these really lift my 27' Fleetwood Rallye like no other. I have not tried to lift the tires completely off the ground but almost had to last week in Mojave. These are worth the extra money!
customer_reviews.author: Poorshanutt

customer_reviews.title: Great scissor jacks!!
customer_reviews.text: These are overkill on my little tent trailed but they are so much easier to set up compared to the flimsy stands the trailer came with. My trailer is so much more stable now when it's fully set up! I would buy these again at that price in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: David J.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They work great, anyone want to buy them??? We don't need them anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Vin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these jacks for our 24 ft travel trailer. They were easy to bolt on and worked very well. They could easily be used on a much larger trailer with success. They go up higher than some so it made leveling the trailer easy.
customer_reviews.author: JSDenn

customer_reviews.title: Very nice jacks
customer_reviews.text: Installed these jacks on my 5th wheel . They were easy to install and work very well. Moving them up-and-down is very smooth and easy to do. I would buy them again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L.

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price
customer_reviews.text: These are at least as good as the products I have seen at the RV dealers parts stores and through Amazon I was able to get 4 jacks for what the dealer charges for 2. They are on my trailer now making leveling so much easier. 24" is a long screw so would recommend purchasing a 15mm socket and drill adapter for your cordless drill to put the icing on the cake.
customer_reviews.author: D. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacks, Low quality mounting bolts
customer_reviews.text: The jacks them self work great and I would recommend them to anyone. I am about to order another set to replace the rear jacks on my trailer as I type this. The only reason they are not five stars is because the self tapping bolts are of low quality. I sheared two off trying to get them in using a ratchet.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Camper jacks
customer_reviews.text: So when you do something wrong or absurd, this is a deal. We screwed up one of our jacks and needed to replace it. I do check with reliability and recommendations and with the price and recommendation we tried them. No problems what so ever!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeni R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: These work great. I used them to level my old camp ...
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I used them to level my old camp trailer and keep it from tipping when we are in it.
customer_reviews.author: Krang

customer_reviews.title: mount like directions say
customer_reviews.text: Almost twice the size as original equipment, mount like directions say, drill out holes sow screws sent will work. I used two self tapers an two 5/16 bolts more than enough to do the job.jacks go up an down easily, good product
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Evans

customer_reviews.title: Good jack... handle not so much
customer_reviews.text: Jacks are great! However, the jack handle broke the 1st time we use it. Seller would not respond to request for another one.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Amazing jacks at great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement jacks for factory crap jacks. One jack alone lifted the whole back end of travel trailer. Install was very easy, had a harder time removing old jack then installing these. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Dominick

customer_reviews.title: Much better than what came on my trailer
customer_reviews.text: These scissor jacks are very nice and are much better than the factory supplied jacks on my travel trailer. I use a cordless drill to make them go up and down with ease.
customer_reviews.author: 2Peps

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: As described and working well for us. No mechanical problems or defects so far! Will probably end up getting another set to replace other two older stabilizing jacks.
customer_reviews.author: Deb B

customer_reviews.title: Very strong and cranks easily
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace cheap factory jacks on a 4800 lb aluminum frame travel trailer. These are strong enough to lift the rear of this trailer completely off the ground (which they aren't designed for). They crank easily with the included hand crank and also with the camco socket I ordered at the same time. Using the socket, I have no problem leveling with a small 12 volt cordless drill but the 19.2 volt drill does work faster. I do plan to replace the other 2 jacks on the front of this RV with the same jacks.
customer_reviews.author: DR Patton

customer_reviews.title: So far so good..
customer_reviews.text: They way probably 50% more than my stock BAL stabilizers. So far so good...I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: John Richard

customer_reviews.title: Well Constructed
customer_reviews.text: Similar quality to the best BAL scissor jacks. These also have thrust bearing to make cranking them up under load easier.
customer_reviews.author: MGL

customer_reviews.title: great product.
customer_reviews.text: product seems to be of sufficient strength and operate smoothly. I had to build longer brackets for my installation, but that was due to a lp gas line in the way. great product.
customer_reviews.author: Allen L. Stears

customer_reviews.title: If you don't use them a lot they would be ok.
customer_reviews.text: Less then 6 months and I had to replace them because they would NOT spin up!!
customer_reviews.author: Harold hensley

customer_reviews.title: RV jacks.
customer_reviews.text: These jacks are HEAVY DUTY. Sure beat the original equipment. Nice smooth operation. You will have to drill new holes thought. My steel was to heavy for the self starting bolts to self tap. But with a starter hole they worked great. This is a quality item. It is not however made in the USA. You guessed it CHINA. But, knowing that now I would still buy them.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for cheap lightweight stock stabilizers
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because the stock stabilizers on my 2010 Keystone Passport Ultralight trailer were flimsy and bent easily. The Husky jacks are MUCH heavier but worth it in the long term (an extra 100 lbs won't make a difference). I am having them welded to the frame tomorrow rather than bolted on for greater stability.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Best jacks ever !!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent jacks, great price and they are professionally made, not flimsy, built EXTREMLY rugged. Five star, period !!!
customer_reviews.author: LAW

customer_reviews.title: Good quality Jack
customer_reviews.text: This is a good heavy duty jack. We got 4 and replaced the crappy ones that came attached to our rv trailer.
customer_reviews.author: norkik

customer_reviews.title: sturdy jacks
customer_reviews.text: These jacks are really great and very sturdy...they come pavkaged good and had all the parts ..you can fasten to your trailer or leave them off to move them around..great product for the price
customer_reviews.author: flhtxlz

customer_reviews.title: a superior product
customer_reviews.text: These are by far improved over the jacks that came with the trailer, I used the for extra support on the downhill side of where it is setup right now.
customer_reviews.author: Sagebrush Racer

customer_reviews.title: replacments
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair to replace oem on Outback travel trailer. Had to drill new holes as the oem were very lightweight. They work great. Very easy to extend and retract with a cordless drill.
customer_reviews.author: DRCHEESE15

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy and well made
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how well made this are compared to the ones I have seen elsewhere. Additionally, they have a much longer reach than many others making them useful without so many blocks of wood.
customer_reviews.author: Leo’s

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality and installs very easily
customer_reviews.text: Awesome quality and installs very easily. Made the travel trailer much more stable and got rid of that "being on a boat feeling."
customer_reviews.author: Paul Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: These were exactly what we were looking for. The quality is much better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Lylann

customer_reviews.title: Very Strong!
customer_reviews.text: Great item, smooth operating, and easily installed. Great big size and super strong that supported lots of family traffic and my camper did not budge or loose stabiltiy.
customer_reviews.author: Ed in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Super strong
customer_reviews.text: Install was a little difficult but well worth the effort. These make the original equipment stabilizers look like erector set toys.
customer_reviews.author: Silver Trumpet

customer_reviews.title: Work Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 7x16 bumper pull enclosed trailer to replace the stock jack that I left down and accidentally broke. These are really over kill for my intended purpose but they work great, installed easily and are easy to operate up or down. I purchased the socket that fits them and can be used with a drill to raise or lower and they work great!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Reasor

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty jacks for 27' travel trailer. Bought to replace electric jacks which do not give enough stability in camping spots that aren't level. These work well. Arrived quickly and in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: maxine3578

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These things look great. They are made of 1/8" steel which is no comparison to the ones that came with my camper. I only got 2 to replace the 2 I bent the teeth on. I haven't camped yet, but they really seemed to tighten up the shake. When I get 2 more it will definitely be solid with most of the sway coming from the tires.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very easy to install, good quality, strong enough to level my 28' trailer
customer_reviews.author: Doug Bolthouse

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: These jacks work great! I mounted four of them on my 26 foot travel trailer and they do the job. I used the supplied bolts and may weld them on later but for now they do the job!
customer_reviews.author: CaptRick

customer_reviews.title: These work great and are a real value
customer_reviews.text: Wow! much more heavy duty than I expected. These work great and are a real value. Easy to install in the back compartment of my motorhome.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L. Hutter

customer_reviews.title: Better and cheaper than original replacements!
customer_reviews.text: These are soooo much better than the BAL brand that were OEM. Easier to crank more stable and fold further under the camper to stay out of the way. You will be happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The install was simple and they are way better than the factory ones and way more sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace the cheap originals jacks that Jayco put on our camper from the factory. The install was simple and they are way better than the factory ones and way more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I mounted them under my 21' Tioga motorhome to help level and stabilize it. They work as good as I could have expected. Recommended. Note that they won't stabilize side to side, just up and down.
customer_reviews.author: Kennaldo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Reduced sway on my toy hauler buy 80-90% !
customer_reviews.author: ADillwith

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: My new trailer did not come with front jacks so we bought these. My husband welded them on and they are fantastic. Very heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: ... these on our 23' camper trailer and they work great so far
customer_reviews.text: We installed these on our 23' camper trailer and they work great so far. They were fairly easy to install and are smooth to unwind/wind.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolle

product_meta.title: Husky 76862 Stabilizing Scissor Jack - Set of 2,Black,24 Inch
product_meta.description: Size:24 InchHusky scissor jacks stabilize and level your travel trailer or 5th wheel. Lifting capacity of 6,500 pounds per jack. Universal design of sturdy steel construction fits most RVs. Permanently mounted jacks are conveniently concealed when not in use. Attaching hardware, instructions and easy-to-use swivel handle are all included. Can be welded on. Easy installation. 35 sq. inch base plate. Black powder coated. 2 year limited manufacturer warranty.
feature_bullets: 6,500 pounds lifting capacity per jack and total lift of 24 inch
Attaching hardware, instructions and easy-to-use swivel handle are all included
